metadata.titleEn: Monitoring data on lake water temperature in Bangong Co and Dagze Co (2012-2013)
metadata.description:
Lake water temperature data, including water temperature values at different water depths, were collected in Bangong Co and Dagze Co.
Data collection time:
Bangong Co: July 30, 2012, to August 20, 2013
Dagze Co: August 18, 2012, to August 29, 2013
Data sampling interval: 1 hour
Instruments used for data acquisition: HOBO Water Temperature Pro V2 U22-001 thermometer from ONSET in the USA (https://www.onsetcomp.com/products/data-loggers/u22-001)
The data table was processed and quality controlled by a particular person based on the observation record, and the data with obvious errors were removed. The data have been published in relevant academic journals in strict accordance with relevant regulations.
These data could be applied in modern lake science, hydrologic model research and other fields.
Water depth, unit: m
Temperature, unit: Celsius (°C)
Data accuracy: ±0.2 °C

Feature Specification.Question: What specific characteristics and precision levels are necessary for temperature sensors used in lake water temperature monitoring?
Feature Specification.Answer: precision of ±0.2℃, HOBO Water Temperature Pro V2 U22-001 thermometer

Quantification.Question: What is the data sampling interval for the lake water temperature monitoring dataset?

Definition.Question: What is the purpose and methodology of using HOBO Water Temperature Pro V2 U22-001 temperature loggers in lake water temperature monitoring?
Definition.Answer: The HOBO Water Temperature Pro V2 U22-001 temperature loggers are used for monitoring lake water temperature at different depths. These loggers record temperature data with a precision of ±0.2°C and are deployed at regular intervals of 1 hour. Data collected is subject to processing and quality control by specialists to remove obvious errors, ensuring adherence to standard protocols for accurate and reliable results. These methods support research in modern limnology and hydrological modeling.

Interpretation.Question: What methods might researchers use to ensure data accuracy and reliability when collecting hourly water temperature measurements in remote lake environments?
Interpretation.Answer: To ensure data accuracy and reliability when collecting hourly water temperature measurements in remote lake environments, researchers can employ high-precision instruments such as the HOBO Water Temperature Pro V2 U22-001 thermometer, which offers a precision of ±0.2℃. Additionally, data must undergo thorough processing and quality control to remove obvious errors, strictly adhering to relevant procedural guidelines. Such measures help maintain the integrity of the dataset, as evidenced by its publication in academic journals.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What causes might lead to errors in the water temperature data collected from lakes with varying depths and what are the implications for hydrological modeling?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: Errors in water temperature data can arise from several factors, such as instrument calibration errors, environmental interference, or human error during data processing. The precision of the temperature sensors is ±0.2℃, suggesting that slight deviations might occur due to sensor limitations. Additionally, variations in water movement and stratification can impact measurements at different depths. These errors can affect the accuracy of hydrological models that rely on precise temperature data to simulate lake behavior and water cycle dynamics.

Goal Orientation.Question: Why is it important to monitor lake water temperature at different depths using hourly intervals in hydrological and modern lake studies?
Goal Orientation.Answer: Monitoring lake water temperature at different depths with hourly intervals is crucial for understanding thermal stratification, diurnal temperature variations, and their implications on ecological and hydrological processes. It also aids in developing accurate hydrological models and potentially informs climate change studies by providing data on how lake temperatures respond to atmospheric conditions over time.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements or instruments enable the precise monitoring of lake water temperatures at various depths over extended periods?
Enablement.Answer: The use of the HOBO Water Temperature Pro V2 U22-001 temperature logger from ONSET enables precise monitoring of lake water temperatures at various depths. This device provides data collection with an accuracy of ±0.2°C at hourly intervals, allowing for detailed temporal resolution over extended periods.
